name: Path T Skin Eyelid
title: Pathologic T
notes:
**Note 1:**  In the case of multiple simultaneous tumors, code the tumor with greatest extension.

**Note 2:** Tumor size must be known to assign a value of T1 or T2. You may use a physicianâs statement of the T category if this is the only information in the medical record. If the tumor appears to be in the T1 or T2 categories, but no size or category is specified, assign TX.

**Note 3:** For the following descriptions, assign the appropriate T category (T1 or T2) based on the tumor size.

    Lesion(s) confined to dermis
    Minimal infiltration of dermis (Not invading tarsal plate, not at eyelid margin)
    Subcutaneous tissue (Through entire dermis, not invading tarsal plate, not at eyelid margin)
    Tumor invades tarsal plate, not at eyelid margin
    Tumor at eyelid margin
    Tumor involves full eyelid thickness

    Localized, NOS

**Note 4:**  Skin ulceration does not alter the T category.

**Note 5:**  Presence of tumor at eyelid margin takes priority over depth of invasion in dermis/tarsal plate.

**Note 6:**  Metastatic skin lesions are coded in distant metastasis.
footnotes:
*T2 is not defined by UICC in the 7th edition. Approval has been provided by UICC to use "Tumor greater than 5 mm and less than or equal to 20 mm, or invasion of tarsal plate, lid margin, or involves full thickness" as T2.

**T3 is not defined by UICC in the 7th edition. Approval has been provided by UICC to use "Tumor more than 20 mm or any tumor involving adjacent structures or requiring complete resection" as T3.
rows:
Unknown; extension not stated
Not documented in patient record

Tumor 5 mm or less in greatest dimension 
NOT invading the tarsal plate or eyelid margin

Note: T2 has subcategories of T2a and T2b. Assign T2 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories

Tumor greater than 5 mm and less than or equal to 20 mm, or invasion of tarsal plate, lid margin, or involves full thickness

Stated as T2[NOS]

Tumor more than 5 mm, but not more than 10 mm in greatest dimension OR 
Any tumor that invades the tarsal plate or eyelid margin

Tumor more than 10 mm, but not more than 20 mm in greatest dimension, OR 
Involves full thickness eyelid

Note: T3 has subcategories of T3a and T3b. Assign T3 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories

Tumor more than 20 mm or any tumor involving adjacent structures or requiring complete resection

Stated as T3[NOS]

Tumor more than 20 mm in greatest dimension OR 

Any tumor that invades: 
     Adjacent ocular 
     Orbital structures 
     Any tumor with perineural invasion

Adjacent structures, including:
    Bulbar conjunctiva
    Globe
    Sclera
    Soft tissues of orbit

Bone/periosteum of orbit
Skeletal muscle
Underlying cartilage

Stated as T3a

Tumor whose complete resection requires: 
    Enucleation, exenteration, or bone resection

Tumor is not resectable due to extensive invasion of: 
    Ocular
    Orbital
    Craniofacial structures
    Brain

Tumor unresectable, extensive invasion:
    Ocular structures
    Orbital structures

Central nervous system
Nasal cavity
Other craniofacial structures
Paranasal sinuses

Further contiguous extension

Stated as T4
